title: SIXERS Jersey Logo Block.. easy?
content:
Well, I thought this would be easy to find, but it's proven difficult. It's not your standard Pro Block or Varsity.. more like a hybrid semi-serif. It's close to Varsity, but small differences (long middle and exaggerated serifs on E, lowered R centerline, right-angle serifs on S characters) make me think it's either custom, or another lesser-known font. Any ideas?

Sorry for the small sample, but these five letters are all I've got!

(note: This is not the same font used on their vintage jerseys, **[shown here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202082537/http:/www.fansedge.com/Images/Product/51-29/51-29902-F.jpg)**. It's a new style for this year, a modernized vintage, if you will.)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202082537im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sixerslou_3566.jpg)
author: wizard7926

comments.content: Sport jerseys' typefaces are almost always custom.
FontShop has a [FontList](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202082537/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/genres/collegiate_athletics/) dedicated to that style.
